It was one of those rare days in Ponyville. A gray and gloomy Spring day where going outside was not impossibly, but still made unpleasant by the constant light drizzle of rain.          Inside the Castle of Friendship one figure paced nervously in a circle.
         As per Twilight's usual habits, as soon as she'd been gifted with the castle she made a list of all the rooms as well as their uses. Some were clear, such as the library with all it's shelves, and some where empty and left for her to fill. When the fount had been done the shocker had come in. Including broom cupboards, attic space, basement, and several spare guest rooms and bathrooms, all total Twilight had 198 rooms in the castle.And with so much space she'd set about putting it to use. Getting especially creative with the purposes of some rooms.
         In this case the room presently occupied was the designated 'Worry Room'. A place where anxieties could be let out, pillows could be sat on or thrown about, and no sharp objects or corners were close by in case of a potential panic attack. Twilight had even padded the ceiling after her first few breakouts as an alicorn had her flying up nervously until she banged her horn.
         However today it was not being used by Twilight.
         "Oh what am I going to do do?" Spike groaned as he unknowingly completed his fiftieth circuit around the room in the faint groove Twilight had worn into the crystal with all of her own pacing.
         "Well for starters you could talk to me," Spike jumped a bit, having not heard Twilight enter the room, "What's wrong Spike?"
         The young dragon fidgeted and tried to brush off her concerns. "Wrong? Why would anything be wrong? Everything's right, right? "And if everything's right then it can't be wrong, right?"
         "Wrong," Twilight replied bluntly, "You've been pacing for almost an hour now. Just tell me. You know I'll help if I can Spike."
         The young dragon sighed, "It's about our guest coming today."
         "Oh you mean Ember?" Twilight smiled but her look turned to concern, "I thought you'd be happy to see her?"
         "I am!" Spike nodded, "It's just... I was hoping I'd have grown some before we saw each other again."
         Twilight gave him a good-natured chuckle, "Spike you shouldn't fret over that. Dragons take thousands of years to grow. Ember's father probably took a good ten thousand years to get as big as he is. I'd guess Ember herself is a couple hundred years old at the very least. You're not do for your next growth spurt until you hit fifty.
         "But that's just it, she's so much bigger and cooler than me, I was hoping I might grow some and at least be her equal if not a bit bigger and more impressive."
         "Spike," Twilight smiled and drew him into a hug with her foreleg, " You don't have to worry about that, you impressed her plenty when you met and worked together. And you more than won her over when you gave her the leadership of the dragons."
         "Maybe, but isn't there some magical way I could be bigger before she arrives?"
         "We've talked about this, Spike," Twilight sighed as she let him go, "Magic on Dragons is extremely risky. Especially if it changes they're physical being. The mustache I gave you was just a simple trick compared to trying to change your whole body."
         You don't remember what happened when i hatched you, she continued, "That surge of magical energy made you grow into a full sized dragon temporarily, but you were under developed, A newborns mind in an adult body."
         "But you could do it again, with more control this time," Spike suggested, "You were just a unicorn filly and now you're an alicorn princess."
         "It's not that simple Spike," Twilight began a slow pace of her own, "When I hatched you my magic became linked to you. That's's why Celestia had me practice by doing things like giving you a mustache or changing your colors."
         "Ugh, I looked terrible in pink," Spike muttered in an aside.
         "By practicing on you my magical powers got stronger, but at the same time your body has built a resistance to magic as well, primarily my magic."
         "So you can't do it then?"
         "Even if I did, my magic would be no stronger or more controllable on you then it was back then," Twilight explained,
         "Isn't there anything that can do it?" Spike asked, almost sounding desperate.
         "Even if there was I wouldn't reccomend it, "Twilight sighed, "Dragon growths aren't something that should be messed with. Remember your greed growth spree?"
         Spike winced, "I try not to think about it."
         "It's natural that you feel the desire to grow, Greed Growth is an important survival mechanism for lone dragons in the wild, but it's lead to more feral dragons than intelligent ones like Ember and those teen dragons we met."
         Again Twilight pulled Spike into a hug, "Just relax and enjoy Ember's visit. I'm sure she'll be excited to see you."
         Spike just nodded as Twilight left the room. The small dragon sighed. He knew Twilight was probably right but the desire to be bigger to impress Ember was still burning inside him. He just had to try something.

It was late in the afternoon, and Twilight Sparkle was making her way back home. She was tired and hoped to have a relaxing evening all to herself. She ran up the steps and entered her castle.

"Good evening, Twilight," Spike greeted, running past her, a feather duster in hand.

"O, hey there, Spike," she greeted back, smiling at her hard working assistant.

She continued down the foyer, but she only took a few steps before Spike ran past her again, carrying a bucket full of soapy water and a sponge.

"Welcome back, Twilight," said Spike.

Twilight stopped in her tracks, watching Spike run down the hallway with confusion. Didn't she just saw him a few moments ago? He appeared out of nowhere.

Deciding that it was just her weary mind playing tricks on her, Twilight shrugged it off and continued. But then something very strange happened; Not one but two Spikes ran past her, carrying a heavy basket of laundry between them.

Twilight was speechless. She knew that she was tired, but she wasn't so tired that she was hallucinating. She followed the two Spikes, who ran into the washing room. Pushing open the door, Twilight was met with a huge surprise.

Several Spikes where in the room, washing, wringing out, and hanging clothing. Shocked, Twilight backed slowly out of the room.

The doors in the foyer suddenly burst open all around her and what seemed like hundreds of Spikes came running out. Many carried various cleaning utensils and others wore aprons.

"Hey, Twilight!"
"Hey, Twilight!"
"Hey, Twilight!"
"Hey, Twilight!"
"Hey, Twilight!"

Rooted to the spot, Twilight watched as the hundreds of Spikes greeted her endlessly. After what seemed like hours did the foyer finally clear, all the Spikes disappearing behind the doors.

Twilight finally found her voice again. "What in Equestria's name is going on!" she bellowed.

"Over here, Twilight."

The voice came from a distance, but Twilight could identify where it emanated from. Frowning, determined to get to the bottom of this, she trotted at a brisk pace.

She burst into the study and found several other Spikes inside, all tending to one that was reclining back in a chair. Some were dropping gemstones in his mouth while others were messaging his feet. His round belly seems to be bulging further out than usual.

The original Spike opened one eye and said calmly, "Hey there, Twilight."

"Spike," she said sharply, "what did you do?"

"Got help, that's what," said Spike, gesturing to the others around him.

"You mean..."

Spike grinned. "Yup, I used the mirror pool to make copies of myself," he said, "Needed someone to help me out, but I made so many that there's really no work for me to do, so I'm relaxing, taking some time off, you know."

"Spike, this is bad," said Twilight firmly, "Remember what happened to Pinkie when she copied herself?"

She approached him and whispered into his ear, saying, "What if this gets out of hand and I have fix this? How would I know which one is the real Spike so that I don't erase you from existence accidentally?"

"With this," he whispered back, showing her the bracelet on his arm.

Twilight's eyes widened when she saw it, immediately recognizing what it was. "Where did you get that?" she hissed.

"Starlight gave it to me some time ago," Spike said, "She said she didn't want it anymore. Anyway, the most important thing is that if you cast a spell it would most likely bounce off. No problem."

"But what if-" she looked around nervously at the other Spikes in the room, hoping that they wouldn't hear "-the others try and steal it away from you? I highly doubt they would fall for a simple trick and be erased."

Spike was taken aback. "Uh, I didn't really think about that," he said, grinning sheepishly.

"But don't worry," he quickly said when he saw Twilight's angry frown, "I can keep this under control."

Twilight sighed and shook her head. "This is bad, Spike," she said again.

"O, come on!" the dragon whined, growing frustrated with Twilight's stubbornness, "Look around you! The castle's been the cleanest in ages."

Twilight did look around and took note that the castle was indeed spotless. The copies had done an excellent job cleaning the place.

"Alright," Twilight finally said, giving in, "They can stay for tonight, but tomorrow-" her voice dropped to a whisper again "-they have to go."

Spike grinned happily. "Thanks, Twilight," he said.

But as she left the study, halting in her tracks as three Spikes ran past her, she couldn't help but feel that a ominous presence was hanging over the castle.

There was not one upcoming event, not one threat invading Equestria, and, most importantly to the green dragon, not one pony to boss him around; Twilight had gone to the Crystal Empire to visit her brother, leaving Spike behind to tend to their home.

Yup, if there was one thing he enjoyed the most was being left home alone. Well, almost alone. Somewhere in the castle, Spike knew, Starlight Glimmer was busy working on some spells for her studies, but she, due to being a little awkward in conversation, rarely bothered him.

Speaking of awkwardness, Spike had noticed that the pony had been growing a little nervous and flustered lately. He didn't know why exactly, but he heard that it's about Trixie and a stallion. When Spike asked her for more information, Starlight only said, "It's not meant for little dragons' ears. I'll tell you when you're older."

Spike would usually bristle in anger at that statement. What did she mean that he wasn't old enough? Why, he helped plan celebration, wrote hundreds of letters for Princess Celestia, and accompanied Twilight and her friends on dangerous quests. He could handle Starlight's secret.

Curious, Spike wanted to dig a little further, but then it accord to him that perhaps this could be a personal matter, that he would be sticking his snout into something that he had no business in, so he decided to leave it. But it was on this afternoon that all that was going to change.

The main door of the castle swung open with a deafening boom that echoed throughout the castle, startling Spike.

"Starliiiiight!" a familiar voice screamed in rage.

Spike jumped off of the couch, running out of the library to see what the commotion was about. The green dragon caught sight of Trixie running up the staircase, her face twisted in rage, cape billowing in the wind as she ran.

Worried, Spike followed her, calling out to her, but she didn't stop. He followed her and saw Trixie storm into Starlight's room. Worried, the dragon ran over and peered inside. The two friends were in a heated argument, shouting at each other.

"How dare you!" Trixie exclaimed, pointing a hoof in accusation, "How dare you steal away Black Hearts!"

Starlight gritted her teeth and said, "I won, Trixie. He kissed me. He chose me. That's it!"

"Yeah, and you also got yourself into his bed!" Trixie said with a sly smile.

Starlight gaped in shock. "How did you...?" she began.

"O, you weren't suspecting that I would leave the two of you alone after I saw you, did I?" Trixie said with a smirk, "I spied on you and I saw everything he did, and he bred you good."

It was now Starlight's turn to point a hoof at Trixie's face. "Say what you want," she said, "You're just jealous that he fell for me instead of you. But I highly doubt that any stallion would fall for you with your kind of attitude."

Spike couldn't believe his eyes. Starlight and Trixie, two good friends that went together like peanut butter and jelly, were fighting at each other.

"O really," said Trixie, a sly smile returning to her face, "Well, I bet that I can seduce every stallion in Ponyville."

"O, you want to make bets I see," said Starlight, "Well then, I could do the same."

She held out her hoof. Trixie stared at it for a few moments, took it, and said, "Very well then. Whoever takes the most stallions wins."

And with that said, Trixie stormed off, Spike jumping out of the way, hoping that no pony saw him, leaving Starlight glaring at her as she left.

Spike stood there in the hallway, trying to process what just happened. From what it looks, Starlight had managed to steal away a stallion that she and Trixie was competing against, and Trixie was anything but happy about it, being a complete sore loser.

Now the had shook on a deal to seduce the biggest stallion? Spike may be young, but he knew enough about the Birds and the Bees. They were going to have sex and lots of it. But they would calm down, won't they?

They would come back together, apologize to each other, and have a good laugh about how silly they were. Yes, that sounded what most likely would happen, but then a thought suddenly reminded Spike of something.

Even though they had mended their old ways, joining the side of the good guys, they were still cunning tricksters, and when it came to bets they never backed down. Spike had a feeling that something very bad was going to happen.

Apple Bloom yelled back as she clopped down the long hallway, "It's okay, Twilight! Ah didn't want to take up much more of your time, anyway! We'll continue another day!"

Twilight sighed in disappointment, "And here I was hoping I could spend a little more time teaching something different...I guess even finally getting those cutie marks can't stop those fillies from taking on new challenges.", Twilight then smiled warmly and giggled in amusement. She nodded serenely as she began to clean up.



~~~~~~~~~~~


Apple Bloom briskly trotted through Twilight's castle halls, some thoughts going through her head as she already began brainstorming how to proceed on her new project.

"Ah could always just learn how to cook from mah family and their recipes...But, Ah also wanna try doin' mah own thing..."

Then, Apple Bloom skidded to a halt as she realized what wing of the castle she was in. She looked towards the large, violet door that lead to the castle library.

She put a hoof to her chin, "Hmmmm...the library could have a cook book Ah could use ta learn some new recipes...But, we've got family recipes at home, too..."

Then, she just remembered something, "Wait a minute. AJ is the only one at the farm, right now. And, Big Macintosh took Granny Smith to Whinnyapolis for an elderly farmers convention...They could be gone for a while. AJ could teach me how ta cook family recipes, but..."
113211.title: A non-culinary Apple

choices: Apple Bloom gets back to Sweet Apple Acres
Apple Bloom runs into somepony as she leaves
1132111.content:
Apple Bloom nodded to herself and began pushing the large double doors of the library. She poked her head around to see if Starlight Glimmer or Spike were in there. It seemed as though there was nopony.

"Alright, how hard could lookin' for a cook book be? Ah've been around Twilight long enough to know a thing or two about browsing for books."

Apple Bloom searched the various sections and genres of the incredibly large and winding shelves. This was much bigger than the Golden Oaks Library.

"No wonder Twilight misses that old tree...This place feels more like a maze than a library!"

She searched and searched, looking for a tome suitable for her needs. Until she reached a deep point in the mystical library that felt mysteriously untouched and isolated.

"D-Darn...Ah feel a little bit uncomfortable about this decision, now...", she began to feel lost and overwhelmed by the sheer scope of this unfamiliar part of the castle.

Then, however, she glanced to a shelf of 'Powerful and Enhancing Arts', and saw a book in the cooking genre.

"Oh, hey!", Apple Bloom trotted to the untouched book and nabbed it enthusiastically.

She looked at the cover, "'The Big Fat Book O' Plenty: A culinary resource for truly remarkable cooking'.", Apple Bloom hopped excitedly, "Alright! This here's just what Ah need!"

She flipped the book to read the back, "'This legendary cook book is the key to becoming the ultimate, gourmet master. The text is enchanted to give any fledgling chef whatever ingredients or materials required for each and every recipe within, on a whim.'...GASP! Ya don't say?! Wowee! Ah've struck gold, baby!"

Apple Bloom did not look any further into the seemingly amazing piece of literature. She bolted back where she came from, book carefully in her jaw. Little did she know that the words inside of this tome weren't the only thing enchanted about it. She could feel an energy welling up inside of her that she had mistaken for growing excitement, but was actually a bit more than that...
1132111.title: Cooking by the Book

choices: Applejack likes it, but tries not to overeat
11321111.content:
Apple Bloom galloped eagerly out of the castle, and through the streets of Ponyville. Her resolve adamant. Her goal so clear. For now.

It wasn't long before she had gotten to her home in Sweet Apple Acres. At the time, it seemed as though Applejack was out in the fields. Mowing some grass, as Applejack never stopped keeping herself busy. Even when it wasn't necessary.

Apple Bloom shook her head and rolled her eyes. "You already did the few morning chores we have right now. And, that grass wasn't even that tall, yet. You're such a workaholic, AJ..."

She placed the book on the kitchen table, hopped on a seat, and began to brain storm what to do next.

"Hmmm...Ah wanna try somethin' simple. But, not somethin' an Apple would normally cook. Oh! Let's see what kinda pastas are in here!"

Apple Bloom sifted quickly through the pages, finding just the recipe she wanted to try.

"MMMMM! It's kinda basic. But, sounds tasty!"

Apple Bloom was startled when the page flashed with light. Pasta noodles, cherry tomatoes, seasonings, several cooking utensils, and even one huge stainless steel boiling pot and equally large steel strainer all popped out of the book. Apple Bloom's mouth gaped in awe for only a second before she realized that these items were about to land harshly all over the kitchen table. She gasped and shot her little forehooves out on pure instinct. Of course, there was normally no way she could catch all the items with such stubs. She flinched and closed her eyes in fear of the impending crash. However, there was no crash, but a strange humming instead.

Apple Bloom's eyes were still closed. With her hooves out and teeth clenched as she was still waiting for the loud noises. As the humming droned, and the loud bangs never occurring, Apple Bloom eased up and opened one eye. Then uttered a loud gasp as her eyes grew to the size of dinner plates. She couldn't believe what she was seeing before her.

"H-Huh?! Wha-!? Ah have magic?!"

She was completely flabbergasted. But, it seemed to be so. Apple Bloom's hooves were glowing a dull shade of green. And, the items that magically shot out of the Big Fat Book O' Plenty were wrapped in the same glow, floating over the kitchen table.

"This...This is...Amazing!!! Ah can't believe it! But, the book gave me magic!!! It must've!", Apple Bloom's grin couldn't curve any wider on her little face. She felt a confidence that was growing into a full blown ego that could put Rainbow Dash's to shame. "Oh, Ah'm gonna be the greatest chef in all of existence!! And, an Earth Pony with unicorn magic on top of that!? This is the best day ever!! HAHAHAHA!!"

Apple Bloom couldn't help but hop in her seat. She looked over the various tools and ingredients granted to her by the amazing book. The Strainer and pot were especially huge. The pot seemed as tall as Big Macintosh, and probably wider than her own stove! The strainer being about as round, but half as tall. The utensils and ingredients were large and plentiful as well. It was a bit overwhelming and the kitchen felt rather clustered with how much the book provided for such a simple recipe. But, Apple Bloom was too excited to care that much. There were only two issues plaguing her mind.

"Gee, how am Ah gonna use these? Our stove and sink are kinda small compared to this pot and strainer...Ah can make so much pasta, though. And, Ah'm gonna need somepony ta taste mah creations...Ah guess AJ can help me out with that...Yeah. Ah want mah big sister to love mah pasta...And, everything else Ah'm gonna be cookin'! Hmmm..."

Apple Bloom suddenly felt incredibly engrossed in this endeavor. She could appoint Applejack as her honorary taste tester. And, with magic, she could probably make a lot of food. She looked over the particular recipe to make sure she did everything right. It occurred to her that she could try cooking the massive meal with her magic. After dumping entire pounds of pasta into the giant pot, she began to get intuitive as she turned on the sink with her powers, guiding a steady stream of water for boiling. It didn't take long for her to realize she could heat up the pot with her aura. For some reason, these things were coming to her rather naturally for somepony who just acquired the ability to use magic. She felt a little put off by this, but the fact that this was all really happening had only driven her to continue basking in it.

She certainly was becoming a true master of the art. As she let the pasta boil on its own, she started mixing in ingredients into bowls from around the kitchen to make the sauce and seasoning for when the pasta was ready. All of these actions that one could do at once with this power. It felt rather simple and especially satisfying. Before long, the pasta was ready to be drained with the massive strainer. It was just big enough to handle the whole meal, and - with the aid of magic - Apple Bloom was able to successfully drain the water and place the pasta back in the pot with no mess.

"Time ta make the most delicious pasta ever!"



~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


As Apple Bloom got to mixing in everything and completing her pasta, the tantalizing aroma of her creation had been wafting out of the window and through the gentle breeze of the late afternoon.

"SNIFF, SNIFF! Golly, what is that...darn good smell?"

Applejack couldn't help but stop in her tracks as she pushed the mower back into the nearby shed. Somepony was cooking something that she wasn't used to smelling while out in the fields. Usually, Granny Smith would start making supper at this time. But, the old mare wasn't here, presently. And, whatever was being cooked wasn't at all familiar to her nostrils. Her belly growled loudly.

"Aw hay. Ah'm already starvin' from all this hard work Ah've been doin'. And, Ah'm the one who has ta spend extra time doin' the cookin'. Now that smell's gonna be drivin' mah gut crazy until Ah can finally eat! Ah wish mah appetite would behave and be more patient...", Applejack blushed a bit, despite nopony being around to witness her literal belly aching.

Applejack was well known by her family and friends for having quite the appetite. She was a work horse through and through. And, that meant having the diet of a very productive one, at that. The amount of carbo loading that Applejack had literally grown accustomed to is the reason she was so thick. With muscle, of course. Although...she has been caught eating a bit more than necessary around the winter time by her family. They didn't mind too much, but it was rather embarrassing when the slow - unproductive days of winter combined with Applejack's above average food intake would lead to some rather weighty results...

"AJ, you've been through this. Granny and everypony has told you again and again....Ya ain't fat...At least, for the most part...And, even if ya were, yer real family and friends wouldn't judge ya."

Belly growling more angrily, Applejack shook her head and began rushing the mower back into its proper place. Indeed, Applejack had a bit of an eating problem that was one of the few things that she was rather sensitive and self conscious about at times. Usually it didn't bother her. She was raised as a farm pony. Convinced that good eating meant more energy and productivity. But, even for somepony with this lifestyle, she was prone to going overboard. Particularly when Granny Smith or even some of her own friends would tempt her with their overzealous offerings.

"Sometimes, I feel they're tryin' ta fatten me up..."

Applejack began to realize that the smell was actually coming from her house as she made her way inside, for the day.

"What in tarnation? Who could be cookin' in mah own house without permission? Probably Pinkie Pie oversteppin' her boundaries again... "

Applejack's face grew stern, but also rather relieved as she began to trot faster towards her front door. Her belly grumbled some more, hoping she could still eat whatever was cooking inside, even if it was made by a trespasser.

"Ah really got mah priorities straight, huh?"



~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


Applejack opened the door and gasped at what she saw.

"Apple Bloom?!"

Apple Bloom turned from the giant pot filled with delicious pasta. She smiled broadly at her sister and trotted over to her side eagerly.

"Ah! Perfect timing, sis! Ah know this seems all sudden like, but Ah've decided to learn how to cook! And, Ah've got this great recipe book ta help me!"

Applejack was still beside herself, staring agape. But, as she looked at the huge pot and embraced the glorious smells coming from it, she couldn't help but drool profusely.

"Sis?"

"H-Huh?...Oh, uh - where did ya get such a big pot, Apple Bloom? And, as much as Ah approve of you takin' up cookin', don't ya think this a bit much? And, ya should've probably came to me first before starting all this."

"Ah just couldn't help it, AJ! Ah felt like Ah should be able ta make some wholesome cookin' as an Apple! Now, why don't ya have a seat and try out mah first dish!"

"You didn't answer where-oof!", Applejack was shoved from behind by her sister towards the kitchen table.

"C'mon, AJ! Ah know you're hungry. And, Ah made plenty of pasta that Ah'm sure you're gonna eat most of."

Applejack blushed and glared at Apple Bloom as she took her seat at the table. Her stomach growled fiercely.

"Don't you start teasin', little sis....But, uh...Y-Yeah, Ah could use a heapin' plate of that pasta. Really smells like ya did good for the first dinner ya've ever cooked yerself. Heh."

"This is kinda odd. Such a big pot sittin' on the floor. How did she cook this much in here?...But, Ah just want some grub..."
11321111.title: Becoming a Master Chef

choices: Applejack gives in and eats the whole pot
Applejack still refuses to eat more pasta
113211112.content:
Applejack sat down on her usual wooden chair, staring at the table in front of her. Feeling rather reluctant to indulge in what she expected would be an overenthusiastic Apple Bloom goading her on to eat as much of her first, edible concoction as possible.

“Ah just know she’s not gonna let me leave until Ah let her know how much Ah like this pasta...Maybe Ah can get the message across that the pasta is so good, we could eat from this for the duration of the week. Ah sure as sugar am not gonna let mahself empty this pot too quickly, now...Surely...A-Absolutely not...Even if it smells so durn good...”

To punctuate the thought, Apple Bloom plopped a hearty plate of the pasta in front of Applejack, and tied her favorite - red checkered handkerchief - around her neck. She was too distracted by her thoughts to notice the magic Apple Bloom had used to serve her meal.

“Enjoy, sis! Ah had mah share of it already. It’s delish! But, Ah wanna know what ya think.”

Applejack licked her lips and drooled again. It really looked perfect. Almost as if a picture you would see in recipe books actually materialized in front of her. The smell being all too much to further resist. Applejack couldn’t take it anymore. She just began slurping and chewing the meal with great gusto. Eating like a pig at a trough. Apple Bloom smiled brightly at her success.

“Wowee! It’s as good as Ah thought it was, huh?”

Applejack moaned and inhaled half of the plate in seconds. She licked her lips and smiled at Apple Bloom.

“MM-MM! Ah think it’s better than that, even!”, Applejack dove back in to finish off the pile of carbs. When she was done, she leaned back in her seat and picked up the plate to diligently lick it clean. The back of her chair squeaked a bit as she rubbed her tummy in satisfaction. Belly growling for more.

“H-Heh...Maybe...Maybe one more serving, Bloom?”

“Of course! Ah want ya to have yer fill!”

“Y-Yeah, right…”, Applejack blushed as she was reminded of all the times she was told that. Encouraged to eat her ‘fill’. And, the many times that meant the scale would not be too kind to her, whenever she bothered to weigh herself next. She idly looked to her flanks in thought. A little relieved she could still see the edges of her seat.

“Ah’ve been in pretty good shape for the past few months. Mah butt ain’t coverin’ the seat, either, l-like Ah’ve noticed a few times...A...A little indulgin’ won’t do me no harm…”, her hunger driven mind quickly derailing her discipline.

The family had the habit of seating themselves in a specific manner around this table for years, now. This chair was old, but still trusty. Serving Applejack’s now toned bottom through thick and thin. Quite literally, for Applejack’s fluctuating weight over time had put this chair to the test, every now and then. However, the occasional squeak would sometimes only make her that much more conscious of her waistline and diet. She feared a day when the seat would bend or even collapse; in response to her overfed form.

“Ah’ve never been that big...A-And, Ah’m sure Ah never will be…Ah hope…”

Apple Bloom put the refilled plate in front of Applejack. The older sister’s eyes widened. Apple Bloom managed to cram much more pasta onto the plate, this time. Her stomach roared at the sight, causing her to bite her lip.

“Aheh...Uh, Apple Bloom? Ah think this might be a bit much…”

Apple Bloom just rolled her eyes. “Aw, c’mon, AJ. Ah know ya want it all...Or...are ya lyin’ about the taste?”, Apple Bloom gave AJ the puppy dog eyes.

Applejack gulped and nodded. “Y-Yeah, not gonna lie. This pasta’s amazin’. And, Ah’m mighty hungry…”

The young mare just went ahead and started devouring the food. She was a big eater, and always would be. But, she promised herself that this plate would be her last. It didn’t take longer than half a minute for Applejack to eat had be more than a pound of pasta. And, this wasn’t counting the first serving! Her belly noticeably filled, but not nearly close to ‘full’ for the ravenous farm pony. Of course, she didn’t plan on going all out. She’d resist the powerful urge and convince Apple Bloom they could save the rest of the pot of pasta for the rest of the week.

“Bruuurrp! Aaah! That’s good eatin’!”

She not only naturally ate like a beast. She was even a trained, competitive eater. Many times, Ponyville had witnessed the awe inspiring, lightning fast gluttony that was the Pinkie Pie versus Applejack matchup, when an eating contest was the challenge. As far as the residents were concerned, there was nopony more voracious than them. Even if a few: like Derpy Hooves, Rainbow Dash, Big Macintosh, and Bulk Biceps; came close. Unfortunately for Applejack, she didn’t have the unreal metabolism that Pinkie Pie had. Her’s wasn’t anything to scoff at. But, Pinkie literally gained almost nothing for as long as she knew her. And, if she did gain any weight, she burned it off quite quickly. Applejack could get back into shape without too much hassle, but she would suddenly blow up in flab if she wasn’t careful. And, converting fat to muscle could become strenuous if she was really bad, beforehoof.

Applejack pushed her chair back and reached her hooves behind her neck to untie her now messy handkerchief, but suddenly wobbled in surprise as her chair skidded back towards the table.
“Wha-?”

Applejack looked over to see Apple Bloom pleading with her eyes. “More, sis?”

Applejack put on a stern expression, “Now, Apple Bloom, Ah appreciate this great meal ya made here. But, Ah think Ah’ve had enough. Besides, we could have this amazin’ pasta for the remainder of the week!”

“B-But, Ah don’t want ta just have the same dinner Ah made, all week! Ah wanna make new meals everyday! C’mon, AJ. Ah know ya’d love that. Who better to judge mah cuisine than mah own sister! A healthy eater, at that.”, Apple Bloom grinned and winked.

Applejack was already a little beside herself. “W-Well, uh...Yeah...Ah don’t think Ah’d mind tryin’ more of your stuff...Ya need a critic, afterall...B-But, sis! Ya can’t expect me ta eat like this every day!”, she pointed at the pot, “That’s quite a load ya made, there. Though, Ah’ll tell ya that pot ain’t nothin’ for this gut of mine...But…”, she blushed and poked her taut, but otherwise modest middle. “Ya...Ya know how Ah am about...well…”

The little pony rolled her eyes and smiled at her big sister, knowingly.

“Oh, AJ. We’ve been through this. No matter what size you are, we’ll always love ya. And, besides,”, she giggled into her hoof, “Ah’ve gotten pretty used to the times ya’ve been mah big sister. Hehehe.”

Applejack blushed some more. Her cheeks almost resembling the apples that were a part of her namesake.

“B-Bloom, please. Grrrrrlll”

“HA! Ya see! You know that stomach wants mah pasta. Piles and piles of the delicious, mouth waterin’, tasty, tasty, Apple Bloom approved pasta!”

Applejack was nearly shivering in her seat. Her gut growling with greed.

Apple Bloom leaned her muzzle next AJ’s ear as another serving seemingly plopped onto the plate from nowhere., “We don’t want it all to go waste, now. Do we?”, she grinned mischievously in punctuation.
113211112.title: Glutton's Hesitation

choices: The next morning, Applejack frets about her weight
The next morning, Applejack hungers for another recipe
1132111121.content:
Like her decision making in the majority of situations she found herself in, Applejack went with her gut on this one. It could only think about swallowing everything in front of her. Potentially filling the void it lived in. For now, that was all that mattered. Like many times before.

“I’ll just work it off, if this meal does any damage. Might as well humor mah sister and mah belly.”

Applejack didn’t say another word. She just dove in and demolished the third serving. Hoggish snorts and grunts filled the room as the gluttonous farm pony partook in her greatest vice. She belched and patted her paunch after seconds of consuming the mound of fattening food. Her muzzle and cheeks stained with sauce that she tried to slurp as much of as she could.

“Keep it comin’, sis.”

Apple Bloom smiled and flung another hefty pile of her creation onto the plate. Her sister too enraptured by her gluttony to notice the abnormal use of magic. Like a machine, Applejack systematically and efficiently ravaged whatever piled in front of her. Her maw taking massive bites. Her cheeks and throat bulging with each swallow. The servings continued, and so did the inflation of the young mare’s tummy. She would only stop to pass gas and make room for more. The handkerchief around her neck was lifting up and getting dirtier as her middle rose like dough and the delicious sauces splattered all over. The orange dome was getting close to brushing the edge of the dinner table.

Apple Bloom giggle at the slobby display. This wasn’t the first time she’s seen Applejack go hog wild during a meal. But, she found it no less funny and endearing. The older sister had somewhat let herself go, in the past. But, Apple Bloom wondered if she never stopped and got back in shape.

“She’d be a really BIG sister. Real heavy...Real soft. Like a big pillow...Sound kinda nice, actually. Mah big, pillowy sister, Applefat.”

Apple Bloom giggle some more. Almost too loudly. Imagining how large her sister should be, with the kind of appetite and will power she had. A roaring belch shook the room as Applejack’s gut pressed against the table. AJ rubbed it and moaned in satisfaction. But, not for long, as Apple Bloom piled another serving. Her eyes glistened with glee as she lifted the plate and practically swallowed everything on it in one bite. She was definitely relishing the opportunity to relinquish her suppressed need to glut.

“She always tries to cut back, and mind her weight all the time. But, doesn’t take much convincin’ to get her ta stuff herself silly. Ah know that, deep down, she’s a big piggy. Wonder what it would be like if she really were one?...She’s gotta be mah taste tester, after all...”

Apple Bloom smirked mischievously. Like any great prank that her or her peers would come up with, there was no passing up the opportunity to put it in motion. Oh yeah. Apple Bloom had a lot of power, right now. She could make as much food as she wanted with the Big Fat Book O’ Plenty, and the magic it bestowed on her. She would learn how to become a master chef, and feed her big sister the way she was always meant to be. It would be downright satisfying and hilarious to turn her sister into an literal cow pony with her cooking. A testament to her own ability to cook. Not to mention, more thoughts occurred to her.

“She would be so much more laid back. All fat, slow, and lazy. Celestia knows she could relax and enjoy herself a little more. It’d certainly make her less of a nag. With mah powers, Ah could do so many chores on mah own! She wouldn’t have to worry about a thing! Maybe it’ll convince her that ponies will still respect her at any size. And...well, she’d be mighty cuddly. Ah’d like that.”

With a new goal in mind, Apple Bloom continued to serve Applejack the feast. There was no doubt that the amount of carbs would show their effect on her, soon enough. With the speed at which Applejack ate, she lived up to her statement earlier. That enormous pot of food was no match for her greedy belly. It sat completely empty, on the floor. Apple Bloom made sure that not a glop of food was missed.

“BUUURRRRRAAAAAAAAAPT!!!-Huff-Huff... ~MMMMMM~Slurp...Uuuurrp...S’Good...”

Applejack was actually pushed back in her seat, her hat having fallen over onto the floor, as she leaned her head back and tenderly massaged her pleased keg of a stomach. And, she didn’t manually push the seat back, either. Her stomach did it for her, pressed up against the table. It grew and grew until the the force of the growth pushed her back in the chair. It sat heavily on her lap and gurgled in appreciation. Practically a foot in front of her. Working down the massive offering into inevitable pounds of fat for her various assets. Her eyes were glazed over in a drunken stupor. A stupid, satisfied grin on her face. She really enjoyed that, for sure.

“Ah’m gonna sleep good, tonight…”

Right now, she was far from thinking of the consequences of this binge. Like competitions before, she would digest this meal and likely be fluffier, in the morning. But, she couldn’t care to think of anything else right now. This had to be one of the best meals she’s had in some time.

“AB’s a fast learner...If Ah didn’t know any better, that cook book gave her a super power or somethin’. That was too damn good for a first try at cookin’...Ah might be lookin’ forward to what she makes me next.

AJ felt herself dozing off. Eating that much pasta would knock anypony out for the count. Even a trained vet such as Applejack. Her eyes flickered until they slowly shut. Some snoring signified that she was out for the night.

Apple Bloomed giggled and rubbed Applejack’s belly a little. Her big sister cooed lightly in her sleep, appreciating the touch. Apple Bloom then proceed to clean up the kitchen and Applejack’s face with her magic.

“Well, Ah guess Ah can move her to her room.”

Apple Bloom tried levitating her sister out of the chair. Strangely, it took a small amount of extra effort to lift her up with the aura.

She grunted lightly, “Huh. Guess levitating ponies isn’t as easy as makin’ things float. Maybe with practice, it’ll get easier. Could be that Ah used a lot of magic today, too.”

After getting AJ out of the chair it was getting a little tiring to walk on her back legs, since she had to have her forelegs out to cast the aura.

“Huff. This’ll be harder than Ah thought.”

Applejack just snored peacefully as Apple Bloom laid her on the couch, in the living room. She couldn’t be bothered to levitate her all the way up the stairs to her room.

“Ah’m sure she won’t mind wakin’ up here.”

And, with that, Apple Bloom thought about what she could make for breakfast, tomorrow.
1132111121.title: Gourmet Sister

choices: Apple Bloom had made a huge breakfast.
Apple Bloom had only just begun cooking.
11321111211.content:
One of the roosters crowed his routine wake up call to make sure the farmers got up and ready to take on the new day, as early as possible. The sky was still only dimly lit, as late night had shifted to the early morning. The Apple family were always known to be early risers. So, the rooster felt as if it was his job to keep it that way.

However, the rooster peaked through a window into the family house, and noticed something amiss. Not only did it seem as though the little yellow Apple pony was not in her room, but the orange Apple pony was laying on the couch! The nerve of her! Ignoring his wake up caw!

The rooster breathed in and crowed again, as loud as he could.

“WHUH-HUH?!?”, Applejack jumped from her deep sleep. Her eyes shot open as her hat slumped right over them.

“Ugh. Jus’ the rooster. YAAAWN! Frrrrrrrt...Heh, good thing nopony's in here. Feel like Ah’m gonna have one o’ them lazy, careless days.”, Applejack licked the dryness in her mouth and itched her side with a hoof. Immediately, she prodded a little more as two sinking feelings surfaced.

The sinking feeling in her chest caused her to frown and worry, "Sweet Celestia...Ah didn't think it would be this bad, so quickly."

And, of course, the other sinking feeling was the one on her barrel. Her hoof poked into the new flab that seemed to have developed on her body overnight. She lifted her hat off her face with some hesitation, gulping as her anxiety built up over what she would see on her frame.

She gasped. A blush grew on her cringing face as she began exploring some unsightly bulges on her sides and middle with both hooves. The massive pasta feast had done some damage. Some inches of chub had developed around her torso. Nothing too substantial. She really didn't seem that different from yesterday. But, a noticeable gain from only one meal for the paranoid mare. She lifted herself into a sitting position and grunted as the pudge bunched up a little on her belly. And, she felt her flanks cushion under her a little bit.

"This has got ta be a dozen pounds! M-Maybe even worse than that! Ah knew Ah should've stopped mahself last night!!!....That was some pasta, to make me bulk up this much in one night...What in Equestria was in all of that?"

Even though she had some choice words and questions for her little sister, Applejack needed to accept that she had to get a better idea of what the damage was and plan a routine exercise and diet as soon as possible. And, of course, she needed to do her normal morning routine.

"Siiigh. Better get up to that bathroom...A-And, gulp, take out the scale."

Applejack hopped off the couch, grimacing as she felt herself jiggle a bit from the impact. Perturbed, but ultimately keeping up the resolve to move on with her day, Applejack trotted up the stairs to freshen up and probably talk to Apple Bloom about this new activity of her’s.

After her morning hygiene routine, Applejack opened the closet and stared at the bane of her existence.
“There ya are. Ya flat, plastic demon.”

Although Applejack was known for her unbridled honesty, she didn’t take kindly to criticism. And, one of the critics she hated most was this cheap, Equestrian scale. It was quite standard for the average pony household, but rather old by their current standards. Mostly made of plastic, with an old dial that only went up to 300 pounds. It was not really a priority for the Apple family to worry about such a thing. And, not even Big Macintosh was that heavy. He was around 240 pounds. Bigger than most stallions. But, not by much for any body builder. No point in worrying about some appliance to tell the weight of a bunch of farm ponies, anyway. That is, until Applejack became so self conscious about her own weight. Applejack had contemplated on getting a new one, just in case. But, ultimately was convinced she would never come to that necessity. That being said, she hated these damn things. 123222.content:
"Next up: Double Diamond."

It was whenever those four words were uttered that every single pony in the gym would stop what they were doing, even glancing up from their phones to watch, always a look of interest plastered on their faces. Everypony but Shining, of course, who would always lean back to escape from everypony's line of sight.

"Coming, coach!" Came a voice that was always light and cheerful with a weight that would've normally left him wheezing on top his lungs. The coach cringed as Double Diamond bit down the last of his bean burrito, its wrapper getting pushed into a trash can whose mouth was stuffed with several others; as friendly a student he may have been, the Coach could still feel all the pained spots in his scalp from tearing his mane out over Double Diamond bringing food into class, at how many detentions, suspensions, and parent teacher conferences he'd threatened to arrange before just giving up. With an appetite as big as Diamond's was, to get him to stop eating something was chiseling Canterlot off of its mountain with a toenail clipper.

Whenever Double got up from his personal bench, an incredibly wide sheet of super-reinforced metal that was still warped into the shape of his massive tush, Shining always expected the floor to cave in right underneath and send him falling into the locker rooms, despite that the second floor's ground was solid concrete supported by metal beams. Having known him since kindergarten, Shining, as well as everypony else who knew him, always saw Double as the fat kid in school, going quite often with a candy bar or bag of chips in his hands to snack on, but it wasn't until his later years that it was clear that he had a lot more than just a sugar tooth. Whenever his hands were free, whether he be talking with friends or in the midst of class, no matter how impossible it would seem to smuggle food on his person, Diamond would eat. And grow. He ate, and grew, and ate, and grew, and ate, and grew. His parents would watch in utter panic as their son inflated into a sapient parade balloon before their very eyes, always at ends to find clothes that would actually fit him, but it was when he broke six feet in height and destroyed their scale at 550 pounds that they all had a firm grasp of what the rest of their lives would be like.

By the time he'd entered his freshman year, he was a foot taller than his father, a former star of the school's hoofball team. A title that Diamond easily blew away by the size he became at his senior year. It took a long time for the sight to become a common occurrence around the school, but Double possessed a stomach so overblown in size that it was comparable to a snowball that was allowed to roll down a ski slope until it was almost nine feet in diameter, being so heavy that it stood on the floor even when he was standing nice and tall. So much of its white fur was always exposed no matter how large a shirt or sweater he'd find to wear, always riding up will it was inches from being sucked underneath his large moobs. There were always the usual taunts and teases from the other students (whenever they weren't staring at him in utter awe, of course) but a surprising amount of the student body always found his massive, jolly presence something that lightened up the mood around class, a few of the school's athletes even putting on a few pounds to join in. It was actually hard pressed for him to lose sight of many of the females in school, too, all of them in love with how pinchable his cheeks were, and just how soft it might feel to cuddle him.

Just to name some of the many things that made him and Cadance, one of the most popular girls in school, catch sight of one another, something that made Shining clench his fingers around the bench in rage. It only felt worse when he tilted his head down in shame, catching sight of his own body; graduation sat only two months away, and he barely looked like he'd aged past twelve.

The scale was shiny and new, and clearly bought to accommodate for somebody of Double's size in mind, but his stomach covered the entire surface before his feet were even on top, forcing him to squeeze his hooves onto the very lip to fit in, the readout's pole bending under the front of his gut pressing against it.

"9'10", 17,963 pounds." The Coach deadpanned. "That's a fifty pound increase."

"Heh...sorry for cutting back, coach." Diamond joked, a smile on his face that was impervious to any and all comments about his weight.

The Coach grunted, nodding as he scribbled into his clipboard. "Up next, Shining Armor."

...and it was when those four were words were uttered that every pony would go right back to what they were doing, the scale's metal groaning as Double stepped off. Not a single eye turned towards Shining as he made his way over, but he could still feel dozens of eyes of shame glaring down on his back as he set foot on the scale, eyes shut in defeat as the coach observed the reading.

"5'2, 149 pounds." He announced. "That's a one pound decrease."

Shining didn't bother adding a comment and got off, shutting out the next student's name as he went back and sat down on his bench. Once he'd plopped down, chin propped on top of a fist, he was shaken up by a hand as wide as a dinner plate patting his back, but didn't bother to look up at the source of the arm.

"Sorry to hear that, Shining." Double told him. "Maybe you wanna come to my place tonight, to have a little pizza with us?"

"No thanks." Shining muttered. He wanted so badly to respond with some kind of amazing comeback for so long, but what made those words so much more enraging to hear was how genuinely supportive Double sounded, which even Shining couldn't bear to act too mean towards.

Double seemed to get the hint, and didn't say anything more to him as the rest of the students all had their measurements taken. He got himself busy with another three burritos to pass the time, but Shining just sat and let his mind do all the alienation for him. He couldn't let his college years begin like this. No...he just couldn't. He had to do something, and fast.

When the bell rung for class, and all the students began heading for the locker rooms, Shining thought of everything he could do, all the places he could go, no matter how shady they could seem...

"Atfir stiwa safrai...diwa spetrif iedkep...tthi nkin gi wou..."

Try as he could to read the incantation with vigor and confidence, as the book demanded so clearly, Shining's commanding tone mellowed out as he read the passage aloud without any effect. He stopped speaking mid-sentence and slid the book off his desk, sending it falling onto a pile of several others that lay half-open to various other chapters seen as failed attempts.

Even if it was his little sister, Twilight, who seemed to have the growing prowess as the best spellcaster in the family, Shining still liked to consider that he knew his way around one or two spells. Most of his magical studies went into things such as combat or defense spells, all important things to know of when trying to enroll for the royal guard, but he could still get the hang of something more offbeat if he set his mind hard and studied enough, quick enough to be called an average learner.

Beauty spells, however? They were a different story.

It was something that almost made him want to laugh, if it weren't for how frustrated he was at all the complex factors that went into things that seemed as self explanatory as a magical tummy tuck, even worse when he was hunting down for something that was the exact opposite.

"Weight sliders..." He read aloud from the page of a new book. "Utilizing this spall shall supply the caster with whatever measurement along their waist or chest in whatever amount they desire. As long as such numbers are smaller tha- oh, come on!"

Shining was even quicker to toss that book aside, now feeling just as betrayed as he did tired and defeated.

"Alright..." Shining hissed, picking up the last fruit of his efforts at the library, the very last window of hope he could cling onto that the night wasn't all a total waste of his time. Taking a deep breath, he shut his eyes, letting them freshen up before cracking the book open, and stared down with his full, unaided attention...

...at a bunch of crude symbols arranged in some bizarre cipher, not a single one bearing any resemblance to the Equestrian language.

In vain, he flipped a few more pages. The complex language reaching end-to-end along the book, and he gave a defeated groan, dropping his head down in his palms.

"This is the reward I get for trying to learn..." He quipped dryly, pushing the book aside...

...and it was when the book was right about to fall over the desk's side that he saw a page open askew, giving a flash of an image that, as brief as it may have been, seemed to fish for his attention. He caught the book before it could hit the ground, and he began flipping through again, searching the vague images scrawled within for what he hoped was the very one.

It was right in the book's center, right where the seam between the pages and the cover lay, that he froze, his breath getting trapped in his lungs. The language was still indecipherable, but they surrounded a squared-in drawing of two figures, one an outline that vaguely resembled a skinner pony next to an arrow that pointed to one that was noticeably chubbier, the latter with tinnier arrows pointing outwards around its body.

Shining stared at the page, mouth hanging open until he felt his lips go dry. Licking them, he studied the page for any remote means of identifying the instructions, whatever ones there even might have been, but all the text remained stagnant in his eyes, unchanging. It was when he looked closely at the image, at an inscription drawn underneath in a lighter shade than the rest of the text, that he could even recognize a clue to what the spell's working was; the magical signature. Not a complete summation of what the spell did, but an algorithm representing the mental cues that went into casting. As of now, nothing more than a blind set of directions into some random location.

It was one of the rare moments he actually took Twilight's ravings during dinner to heart, and he glazed over the spell's anatomy till he though the could try it to heart. Taking the book in his hand, he stood up and trotted over to the mirror along his closet door, gazing upon his reflection with as much confidence as he could try and give off.

Well...here goes something.

Shining deeply inhaled through his nostrils, and his face wrenching up as he clenched all the muscles in his forehead at once, squeezing out a spark of magic that traveled down his horn in a purple glow. He concentrated the flow of power into a nice, blank stream, and he tugged at it with his thoughts, prying it into the same pattern of symbols from the inscription. Obscure as it may have been, the sequence seemed easy enough that he felt he could finalize it in little time, and once he was satisfied, centered his thought on the tip of his horn, the energy gathering into a bright orb of light.

And...Now!

With a secondary surge of energy, he pushed against the magic packed into the orb, and it shot free of his horn. Shining stood with his eyes shut, expecting some kind of explosive sound or rush of feeling to over take him, but his head remained tilted down as he listened into the silence of the room. Not feeling any different, he cracked one of his eye lids open, then the other, immediately noticing that his body wasn't changed.

Instead, his eyes were drawn up to a green light shining on the floor. His gaze was drawn upwards, and he shrunk away at a churning blob of energy that hovered just a few feet away from his face.

"...what the he-"

The blob seemed to see a chance when Shining's lip parted, and it shot straight into his mouth, worming its way right past his tongue and against the back of his throat. Shining jumped back into his bed, too shocked to even swallow; he could feel the magic do all of that itself, feeling it force itself down his throat and into his stomach like a fish.

Panting, startled, and flustered, Shining sat on the edge of the bed for a stretched amount of time. He didn't feel any change taking effect, and he held a hand to his abdomen, questioning what he'd done to himself...

...and he felt his palm connect with his stomach than it should've. It felt tight, too, despite him having not eaten or drinking anything since a few hours ago. Gazing downwards, he he blinked at what he saw, realizing how truthful the picture was. It wasn't anything gratuitous, but his stomach did seem a little bigger than before, enough that there was a distinct roundness hiding under his shirt that conformed around his naval, but it only felt as though he'd chugged a liter of soda.

"Well..." Shining observed. "It's...progress, I guess."

Discord gave a toothy smile as he eyed the crystal castle at the edge of Ponyville.
         Who better to annoy than the element of Magic?
         For some reason Discord just loved to mess with Twilight. Her logic and scientific reasoning was the perfect counterpoint to his unpredictability. With one more bit of a delicious cupcake Discord snapped his fingers and his whole setup vanished from the skies over Ponyville.

==========

         Twilight wasn't having a good morning. It wasn't a bad morning per-sway, but it was just one of those mornings when everything felt like it took five times more effort than usual to accomplish. She'd rolled out of bed with thump, dragged herself to the dresser, grabbed her come and proceeded to brush her messy mane five times before the handle broke.
         Grumbling about replacing it, Twilight proceed down the hall, past Spikes room where he was still snoring, down the staircase and across the large dining hall before finally arriving at the kitchen. She could have teleported perhaps but the last time she tried it while feeling so out of it she'd had to apologize to Berry Punch after landing on her Dining Room table during breakfast.
         Yawning Twilight looked around the admittedly huge kitchen and tried to decide what to have.
         Pancakes sounded good.
         She went to the cupboard and pulled out the mix. It took reading the instructions three times before the words sunk in. Bowls and measuring cups and spoons were gathered, the stove top and pan was heating. Cooing oil sat beside it. She needed eggs and milk.
         Twilight walked to the fridge opened it, Nodded to Discord, grabbed the eggs and milk. Turned around and... Wait, what?
         "You know it's rude to close the door on someone who's just saying hello," Discord huffed appearing next to Twilight with a pop.
         Twilight blinked, there was a second or two of silence before her mind kicked into gear. "Oh! Sorry Discord," she apologized, "Just... felt a bit fuzzy this morning."
         "Well newsflash Twilight," Discord chuckled ruffling her mane a little with his clawed hand, "You're always a bit fuzzy."
         Seeing Twilight huffed again and plod over to her preparations Discord backed off a little but didn't completely let up. "What's got you so run down? Been up late burning the midnight oil?" As if to emphasize this Discord pulled from behind his back a flaming drum of motor oil.
         Twilight however remained un-phased as she set to work, "No, if you must know I was up late trying to decide on a new topic of research. I submitted my thesis on the Elements of Harmony last week and got the news yesterday it will be added to the Encyclopedia Equestria as of next printing. So now I want to find a new field of research."
          Discord gave an exaggerated yawn, "You are unbelievable Twilight. You are the only pony I've ever seen, save Star Swirl himself, who's been desperate to never stop learning. Even Celestia and Luna learned to take a break from such things after a century or two."
         "Well unlike a certain braggart spirit," Twilight replied, "I don't pretend to know everything already."
         "Hey I know I don't know about everything," Discord replied with a snort, "I had to learn about Friendship, remember? If I knew about it already it wouldn't have been such an important lesson."
         "Fine," Twilight acknowledged as she prepared to mix the ingredients, "But you still act like you know everything."
         "That's because I can DO anything," Discord replied with a smirk, "And even if I don't know everything, because I can do anything means eventually I'll learn everything I don't already know."
         "I think that's debatable," Twilight replied, "Besides, no creature can do 'everything'. Even in magic there are certain fundamental laws.."
         "Twilight Twilight Twilight," Discord smirked as if lecturing a small filly, "Surely you as a student know that's not an absolute. Even in nature, for every 'law' that exists there's an exception. For example 'Mammals don't lay eggs' ...Except for the Platypus and Echidna. 'Mammals maintain body heat all the time' ...Except for the Naked Mole Rats." He poofed a animal into each hand as he spoke and dismissed them just as quickly. "You can thank Fluttershy for teaching me those."
         "So you're saying that even magic has exceptions to these laws?" Twilight asked, her minf waking up and now faintly more interested in the discussion over breakfast.
         "Yes," Discord replied, "And I'm sure as a student of magic you know one of the biggest ones of both nature and magic. That being 'Matter and energy can neither be created nor destroyed...' "
         "...they only change forms.' " Twilight finished from memory, "So what's your point?"
         "Watch," Discord smiled and snapped his fingers, a moment later a stack of pancakes complete with butter and syrup appeared.
"          "So?" the lavender alicorn asked not quite understanding what Discord was getting at.
         "Go ahead and scan it with your magic Twilight," Discord smiled, "You'll find this was not a teleport, this was not me instantly making pancakes from ingredients. This was genuine matter creation."
         Twilight had her doubts but scanned the pancakes as instructed and found Discord was shockingly right. She tried two or three different sorts of scans but it was all true. Even down to the atoms these pancakes were only just now created. No lingering spacial distortion of magic for a teleport, no friction from a rapid baking process. All indication showed the pancakes were new matter.
         All of them were promptly speared by Discords fork and stuffed in his mouth, making his neck bunch and expand like an accordion briefly as he swallowed them down.
         Twilight was speechless for a moment but she found her voice as Discord swallowed the delicious meal, "Chaos magic.. can it actually be studied?"
         "Pardon?" Discord asked, wiping his mouth with a napkin before eating it too.
         "You cay chaos magic can basically do anything, that it's as wild and unpredictable as you are, but I don't believe that's entirely true," Twilight began pacing a bit as she thought, "You snap your fingers and what you want to happen happens. Ergo there must be a way to control this powerful magic. And if it can be controlled then it can be studied. Maybe even taught."
         "Whoa now Twilight," Discord looked a little uneasy, "Are you sure you want to get into this? Chaos magic is not some new toy. It can be dangerous if you're not careful."
         "Discord, I've decided, I want my new field of study to be Chaos Magic. Will you assist me?"
         The chaos spirit mused at this a bit. On the one clawed hand Twilight wielding chaos magic would be humorous to see and he could indulge in tons of food as 'examples' of his magic. On the other pawed hand if things got out of control he was likely to receive a lecture from Celestia and Fluttershy both. And while Celestia's lectures could put whole armies to sleep, Discord was not keen on hearing another one from Fluttershy.
         Still, it was a chance for fun. So why not?
         "Alright Twilight," Discord chuckled, snapping his fingers and changing into a professors outfit complete with sweater-vest and tie, "I'll be your teacher in this subject. However there is something we must do first..."

"Yoo-hoo, anypony here?" Discord called.

While he banged the ringer on the table, he said, "Very loyal and hungry costumer here waiting to be served! Hello?"

When there was no reply, Discord frowned. He didn't know much about Pinkie Pie's business, but if she was this terrible at shop keeping it was a miracle that the place hadn't closed down yet.

"O well, I might as well help myself," the draconequus said.

He was about to snap his fingers and clean out Sugarcube Corner's stock into his awaiting maw when a hatch behind the counter opened. Pinkie Pie emerged, covered in cake batter and flour, hastily stuffing something that resembled clothing underneath the hatch again.

She was out of breath, like she ran a quite a distance, and uncharacteristically flustered

"Well, hello there, Pinkie," said Discord.

The pink pony jumped in fright. She looked up and saw Discord floating above her, grinning, his bulging belly drooping downwards.

"Uhh...H-hey there, D-Discord," Pinkie Pie stuttered, looking a child being caught doing something naughty. "I...didn't suspect to find y-you here today."

"What's under the hatch?" Discord asked.

"O, i-it's nothing," Pinkie Pie said, beginning to sweat, "Just s-some extra supplies, that's all."

"Mind if I take a look?" said Discord, reaching out to the hatch.

"No!" Pinkie Pie shouted.

"And why not?" Discord asked suspiciously.

"Because..."

Pinkie began to sweat more.

"Because..."

Suddenly, she was struck by an idea.

"Because you haven't tried one of my special cupcakes yet," she said, smiling happily, pulling out a purple cupcake out of thin air.

In the past this would have been a red flag to Discord that something was terribly wrong, but due to his quest to become the fattest being in Equestria he ate the cupcakes whole.

It was delicious like any other cupcake Pinkie Pie makes, but it had another strange taste to it that Discord couldn't identify.

He swallowed and said, "Okay, I ate your cupcake. Now tell me what's under... O, my..."

Discord suddenly felt dizzy, and the next thing he knew everything went dark. He fell from the air, snoring loudly on the floor. Relieved that she was able stop him from discovering his secret, and happy that she had another test subject, Pinkie Pie opened the hatch and dragged Discord's sleeping body inside.

145311.content:
“Uuurggh… I think I ate too much…”

Button Mash had just gotten done with the most thrilling, high-stakes gaming tournament of his life! He’d put ALL of his Ponymon trading cards on the line in the ultimate match of HorseBattle 3… and after seven long, stressful rounds, he finally emerged the victor! Nothing could compare to the feeling of walking out of that sleepover with his winnings - three dozen new trading cards - tucked away in his saddlebag!

However, there was one problem keeping him from feeling too proud of the events. You see, when he was ‘in the zone’ during a game, he tended to snack a lot to keep his stress down. So, during their ‘tournament’, Button Mash had been chowing down on a big plate of cookies his friend’s mom had made them… only to look down afterwards and realize he’d cleared out the entire plate! He’d somehow packed every single cookie away in his gut without even noticing, leaving him feeling all nauseous and bloated.

He’d never felt quite so stuffed. He could feel the contents of his tummy shifting and sloshing about as that big round fluffy gut swayed beneath him, wobbling all around with every belabored step he took, leaving him huffing and puffin. Sure, it wasn’t even close to the biggest gut he’s seen on a pony… but he definitely wasn’t used to being this stuffed! The worst part was, he knew that all those cookies were going to be killer on his weight!

He did his best to remain hidden and out-of-sight as he walked towards his home, praying not to be seen. After all, he was reaching that age where he was always trying to impress fillies and mares, always trying to seem cool and impressive; being all stuffed and round like this would have the opposite effect! He shuddered, imagining the humiliation he’d endure if a group of girls saw him like this and just started laughing at him!

Unfortunately, it seemed like his nightmare might just come true! Just as he was slinking out of some alleyway on the way home… he accidentally bumped right into the side of some mare! His belly let out a loud slosh as it got shaken around with the force of him getting knocked back onto his butt, dazed! “Oh! Sorry about that-” The orange-furred mare was about to apologize… only to turn, and get a big, surprised grin at the sight of his belly! “Oh. My Celestia.”

His cheeks immediately flushed red, expecting the mare to start laughing at him any second now! Instead, though… she seemed delighted! “You are SO CUTE!” She cooed. “How did you get so stuffed?”

He blinked, surprised by her reaction. He hardly even knew what to say! “Ummm… I ate too many cookies?”

She giggled, seeming to fawn over him. “Oh my goodness, that is just adorable!!” She nodded, before turning around and glancing over her shoulder. “Hey, Fern! Check out this colt!”

To his shock, another mare walked curiously up to him in response to the orange-furred mare’s call… only for her to get that same delighted look on her face! “Oooh my! He’s absolutely adorable!” They both giggled to eachother, lost in the cuteness of his tubby belly and flustered expression. “His belly’s so big and soft! It’s sooo cute!” His blush deepened, surprised by this development! Did these mares really… like his belly?

As if to answer his question, the orange-furred one leans in. “Mind if we feel that tummy, little guy?” He was still shocked by all this… yet, nonetheless, he nodded. Immediately, both of the mares forehooves started to press against his tummy, cooing as they explored just how soft and squishy its fluffy surface was. Button Mash couldn’t help but melt into their touch, enjoying the tummy rubs as it helps him digest their food. He gets a little embarrassed when their rubs make him let out a big belch, but they don’t seem the mind, only giggling. “Gosh! It’s so big and soft! You’re like a big squishy teddy bear!”

Quickly, Button Mash had gone from feeling embarrassed, to feeling weirdly proud! He felt like a total ladie’s man, having these two mares fawning over him, even if they just thought that he was cute. Eventually, though, he was knocked from his trance when one of the mares leaned forward… and blew a big raspberry playfully on his belly, making him giggle and laughed at the ticklishness! “Hehe! Sorry, cutie pie, I couldn’t resist!”

Button Mash just laid back for a few minutes and enjoyed having his big stuffed belly rubbed and doted on by the giggling, delighted mares for a while… but eventually, sadly, they had to part ways. “Thanks for letting us rub your belly, cutie pie! It was suuuper cute and squishy!” The mares left him with one last, big group hug! “Never let anypony make you feel ashamed of gaining weight or anything! It’s really just precious!”

With that, they were on their way… leaving Button Mash feeling better than ever! He now strut through the streets of Ponyville proudly, showing off his belly and letting it slosh as it swayed beneath him like a hammock! Even now, he notices mares whispering to eachother and giggling about how cute he is as he passes by. He felt like the king! He had no idea that mares thought pudginess was so adorable, but if it gets him more attention (and belly rubs) from them, it sounds good to him!

In fact… if he gets a little pudgier, he can have a belly like this all the time. And then, he was sure he’d be the most adorable thing in town!

By the time he gets home, he finds his mom...

"Uh...breakfast time, Apples!"

So long ago was it since that phrase was something that lit up the Sweet Apple Acre's house upon speaking, once a warm, welcoming embrace to the sun rising on a new day. Nowadays, it felt cold and sterile in Applejack's lungs with every utterance that came to pass, having turned to a taunting motto of the world they now resided in.

Apple Bloom was gone, probably somewhere off with her friends; bless her soul, she would be spared another day. Applejack was more than glad to stand in her stead, anything to give her sister an occasional whim of freedom, but she still felt a knot travel down her throat as she gave a nervous gulp, eyes jittering in fear as she stared up at the ceiling, ears swiveled and ready to dart towards the telltale sound.

It was just as she'd set the last plate down that it came, as though the owner had long been wide awake, counting through every clink on the table to make sure that every single plate in the house was laid. Truth be told, Applejack almost doubted that every plate in the kitchen would even be enough, even when every single one was piled up with enough food to pop a pony's buttons with thanksgiving dinner, and the red tablecloths was almost totally concealed as the plates came close to overflowing over the edges, such little room left that it looked like one would fall enough with enough of a shake.

Something that Applejack came to fear would happen when a great weight from above planted itself on the floor, with any of the walls below creaking under the strain. It came again, transforming into a set of footsteps that creaked every single floorboard in the house, not just the ones for his room maneuvering towards the steps leading to the family room. Applejack wilted as she saw something red stomp down on the topmost step, and she stepped back behind the table, lest she get in the way, should he charge upon seeing. She forced a smile as a great, wide wall of denim pushed its way against the jagged edges of the doorframe, or what remained of the doorframe, the edges long ago having been torn a few extra feet wider. It was the same every morning, the hole widening out just a little bit more with every trip Big Mac made to breakfast, and this time around, his head took some of it apart as he rammed his gigantic body right through the "meager" opening, the warm smile never flinching from his lips from the familiar scent of breakfast.

With every meal, less and less did Big Macintosh seem like Applejack's gentle giant of an older brother and more like some demon of gluttony that had taken him as its vessel, his face but a caricature of his former self as it sat upon such a wide, paunch-rounred head. Standing in at nine feet tall, there didn't have to be a contest to tell that he was the absolute biggest pony in all of Ponyville, even if it weren't already for the fact that he was several feet wider than the very table he was licking his lips at, the shapely mass of his body dominated by that of his stomach. Covered in a giant set of overalls that only a fashion genius' mastermind could fathom, it posessed a robust orb in shape by the oversized amount of fat and muscle packed inside, devoid of any rolls or cellulite as it staunchly laid upon a wide expanse of floor in front of his hooves, even when he was standing at full height.

"Uh...Mornin', Big Mac!" Applejack uttered in the vain hope that he would respond, that he'd acknowledge her, anything to remind her that he knew she was family, but all he gave was a flick of the air as he trudged over to the table. Really, it was a long time since he'd spoken anything aside from demands for more, never showing any emotion aside from sheer want.

With no chairs left in the house to fit his gigantic behind, he sat right on the floor, the front of his belly wedged against the lip of the table. He wasted no time reaching in, not letting his own midsection act as a barrier as he grabbed for anything edible before him and brought it to his eagerly awaiting mouth. He bit straight into trays of apple cobbler without use of a fork or knife, and hollowed it out in a matter of three large bites before licking the glass clean. The same went for a pile of hay bacon fashioned from four entire packs all fried together, with Applejack watching the twenty bits worth of hay-meat vanish from existence, all being sucked into the black hole that was his body.

As it was for the next plate. And the one after, and the one after that, all the same. Just eat, and eat, and eat, never satisfied, with no restraint...

As the last of the plates clattered to the sides the moment Applejack feared came to pass.

'MORE!" the stallions voice bellowed. There were still traces of her brothers calm and gentile nature to it, but a commanding tone filled his single word to the point of making them non-existent. It put applejack in mind of Luna's 'Royal Canterlot Voice', but even the RCV was more declarations and statements than orders.
