With every plate used she had to resort to pans and pots and any other item that could be used to serve food. Had Rarity been there she might have stood aghast at using cookware for serving but that was only if she could get over the sight of Big Mac stuffing his face into the cakes and consuming every last gob of dough and frosting he was able.

Applejack stood back, hesitantly fingering something in her pocket as she held the last food item, a dish of apple cobbler. She knew this couldn't go on and the other day, when she'd had time, she'd gone to seek Twilight for help...

==========

"I can't take it anymore," Applejack muttered as she paced the crystal floors of Twilight's library, nervously rolling her hat brim in her hands, "I thought it might just be a phase at first, like another growth spurt. Granny always told me Big Mac ate like a dozen ponies when he was growing up, but it was always 'up' and not 'out'. Now... it's like I'm watching him become a landmass right in front of me. I don't know what to do Twilight."

The lavender alicorn sat nearby, book in hand, dressed in blue shirt and purple skirt. Despite being a princess Twilight was never one for such formal wear (regardless of Rarity's eagerness to design for it) and insisted on keeping it simple.

Twilight mulled over the situation as she set her current book aside before her horn lit drawing another couple to her off the nearby shelves."Well if it really is just his body growing then there's little I can actually do Applejack. Messing with your brothers biology could have lasting consequences."

"But what if it's a spell or something?" Applejack replied, tugging at her overalls nervously, "Or an illness? What if he got into some Poison Joke and can't remember doing so?"

"Unlikely," Twilight replied as she flipped through the hovering books, then amended, "Not impossible mind you, but unlikely. Although..."

When Twilight went silent for a minute Applejack had to prompt her to continue. "It's my brother," Twilight finally admitted, "I mean, in my last letter with Cadance she said shining was putting on a few extra pounds these days. Maybe it's just a coincidence."

"But it could be magically related?" Applejack pressed, concern for her brother growing in her chest.

"We don't know yet. Still if it is we need more information. If it's more than Big Mac others might be effected too. I'll look around town over the next few days and ask if there's been anything unusual in this regard."

"But what about my brother?"

"I can whip up something that should stunt his apatite for a time," Twilight stated, "But without knowing the cause of all this, if there even is one, there could be side effects. Nothing dangerous, but you have to be prepared for anything that might happen..."

==========

Applejack held the small vile of green powder Twilight had given her. She just had to sprinkle a light dusting on Big Macs food and hopefully that would be enough. However as the vile began to pour over the cobbler, Applejack's hands, already bit slick with nervous sweat, dropped the whole thing in.

"MORE!" Big Mac bellowed, having finished everything else. With no time to fish out the powder, Applejack handed over the pan and Big Mac gulped it down eagerly.

The excessive weight that hardened his already distended belly reduced his walk into an awkward waddle, but Big Mac's determination wasn't challenged in the slightest as he pushed himself right up against the entire doorway's wall, knowing full well how useless opening them would be.

Applejack was broken out of her shock when all the wall around the doorway was torn right of of the nails and pipes holding them all together, an enormous crater having been dug into the side of their house as Big Mac marched on towards the apple trees, seemingly oblivious to what he'd just done. Without a word, she turned the other way and ran as fast as she could back towards the barn, willing to drag Twilight back to the house if she was busy fighting some new monster, if need be.

As for Big Mac, his mind was hammered upon by the scent of fruit that was starting to surround him. That of vitamins. Calories. Food, food for as many miles as a pony's eyes could see. Not wanting to waste any more time that'd let his stomach empty out some more, he reached out and grabbed the thick end to the branch of a nearby tree, pulling it down so the apples were right within biting distance. For all the apple cobbler and pie he'd gone through at breakfast, the taste of the apples in their pure form was an explosion of delight on his taste buds, and even the leaves gave it a musky flavor that accentuated the quite nicely.

Combined with his hunger, it made him all the more quick to draw off more of the branch, and he took another bite, leaving a noticeable amount of the foot at the tree's leaves totally bare...

By the time Big Mac finished the tree it was virtually stripped down to the trunk. He did try to eat it, but it was too big around to get his jaw around and his insistent hunger demanded more food. So with some reluctance Big Mac moved on to the next tree.

"Holy Horseapples!" Applejack exclaimed, "Look what he's done to our trees!"

"This is getting serious Applejack," Twilight replied, "Big Mac is getting out of control. And if what I've seen in town is any indication he might just be the first. No other stallion has it this bad but there's definitely some with similar characteristics."

"I'm just glad it has hit the foals yet," Applejack muttered though that was some small consolation.

"Twilight just nodded, "I've already written to Celestia, Hopefully she can send help, but with the Royal guard being seventy-eight percent stallions they might not be much help. Especially considering...." Twilight pointed down at the tracks showing the change from Big Macs deep hoofprints to the clawed toes.

"Sweet Celestia!" Applejack gaped, "What in tarnation is happening to my brother?"

"I'm not sure," Twilight replied, "I've never read about anything like this before."

"Well what are we going to do?" Applejack looked about ready to suffer a breakdown with a combination of desperation and fear for her brother.

"If we can get close to Big mac I'll hit him with a sleep spell," Twilight stated, "We can hopefully keep him under until we find an answer."

" 'Hopefully'?" Applejack echoed, questioning the doubt she'd heard in Twilight's voice.

"The spell is designed to work on ponies, but these tracks, those bite marks on the tree... I hate to say it Applejack, but your brother might not be entirely equine enough for it to work."

Applejack bit her lip, nervous. Still they had to try as the pair pushed on, following the trail of consumed trees.


Choice 1: They find Big Mac even more transformed and bigger, eating whole trees now. Twilight attempts the spell but it doesn't work, causing the giant of a fat stallion too change even further.

Choice 2: Same as 1 but the spell does work and Big Mac falls asleep for a time.

Choice 3. Somepony else, say Apple Bloom or Zecorra for example find Big Mac before Twilight and Applejack.
1522213.title: As Big mac eats his body changes further, becom...

15222131.content:
Applejack's heartrate quickened with every hoof print that she and Twilight ran past, with each one bigger and deeper than the last, sitting in a path of upturned dirt that got wider the further they went into the forest. Twilight could hear her let out a whimper when they made it to a tattered sheet of denim that lay dirtied on the ground, one she could remember as a gigantic set of overalls that Rarity'd once spent an entire night fawning over.

"We're going to save him, Applejack. Just keep calm, and-"

"Keep calm?!" Applejack sputtered. She came to a stop, thrusting a finger out at a nearby tree stump that was nearly carved to the ground with teeth marks. "How do y'all expect me to keep calm when this is a part of my life, now?!"

"Listen, I know it's easier said than done, but we need to understand the situation in full first before we can risk letting our emotions get control over us! It's just a matter of..."

But the calmness in her eyes was shattered as they both went wide, ears twitching as she heard the sound of something being dug out from the ground behind her. Noticing Applejack's face go slack with terror, she reluctantly turned her head around at a tree that stood along one of the untouched rows near Big Mac's path, one that was wriggling its way out of the ground, seemingly on its own.

"Twi?" Applejack peeped quietly. "What's goin' on?"

With one last invisible tug, the tree's roots were torn loose of the ground, little clumps of dirt clinging to its tendrils as it floated inwards towards the heart of the orchard.

"Follow it!" Twilight declared before running off in the same direction. Applejack didn't initially register her command, lost in questioning reality for a few moments before she snapped and gave chase, as well. Between the other trees in the orchard, the two could see more being pried at by auraless magic, being torn up from their spots to fly down towards the same source.

"It...It can't be Big Mac doin' this, can it?!" Applejack asked.

"I highly doubt it, but-"

Twilight couldn't ask Applejack why she was slowing down before the entire side of her body'd rammed itself deep into something large, warm, and firm enough that it'd sprung her back several feet, throwing her face-down into the dirt. Spitting up a few bits of grass, she pushed herself up and craned her head to see Applejack's hooves right in front of her, and she trailed her eyes up to see her expression, that of a hypnotized mix of absolute fear, shock, and catatonia.

"Applejack?" Twilight asked, looking backwards to follow her friend's gaze. "What's going..."

As if it was sitting there to show off, taunting them, Twilight's eyes were smacked by a massive field of red that sat along the front of a absolute mountain of red that towered over all the trees it sat wedged between, their trunks creaking under stress as the levitating flora were drawn somewhere at its very peak. She stood up, taking Applejack's side and perfectly matching her gobsmacked expression as the two stepped backwards in complete harmony, only faltering when they both recognized an orange mane that seemed so puny compared to the body it sat on.

Big Mac's legs seemed painfully spread apart to make room for his stomach, now a spheric bulge of red so tightly packed with food and blubber that it was larger than Ponyville's town hall as its weight hung on top of the trees on the very edge of four rows that were dissected on his walk. With the torn tattered of his work shirt dangling along the large bags of his chest like a dirty necklace, all of Big Mac's fur was totally exposed, noticeably longer and scruffier than an average pony's coat would be. That came as the slimmest relief to Applejack, having smoothed out some of the details of her brother's body as she watched him sit naked whilst out in the open, but her mind was reeling far more in the fact that, while three times as big as he'd been this morning, something about him beyond his behavior and size was changing.

Despite being overtaken by a pair of overfed cheeks and a huge triple chin that sat on a huger triple neck, her heart went cold as she made out his face. The shape of his head still seemed the same, but whenever he opened his mouth to bite down on one of the trees that'd float into his mitts, she could see a sharp row of teeth that were each guarded by a thick pair of tusks that pointed out from the cricks of his mouth, effortlessly slicing apart the thick, toughened wood of the apple trees they'd grown. But worst of all, the thing that really glued Applejack to the grass in fear, of course, were his eyes. His pupils had been thinned into slits, something that reminded her of Nightmare Moon's, or a bat pony's, yet something about them seemed more...gleeful. He wasn't just eating out of a relentless hunger, but some kind of sadistic urge that sought enjoyment from him tearing something apart so easily.

Twilight didn't let herself get overtaken as much, and charged up her horn. "Stand back, Applejack!"

Still reeling, Applejack didn't fight Twilight as she charged up a spell and shot it right into Big Macintosh's stomach. He continued to ignore the two as a constant stream of magic was pumped right into him, but it was when the spell was caught up that his face was seized up, pupils constricted in surprise. The two mares waited around, watching as his eyes clenched in pain, hands grabbed at his middle as he slowly got to is feet, his stomach still laying upon the ground even when he was standing nice and tall.

"T-Twi, what's happening?!" Applejack whispered, noticing quickly that Big Mac wasn't falling asleep.

"Shh!" Twilight hissed, holding an arm up in front of her. "Just wait!"
15222131.title: Massive Big Brother, failed spell

152221312.content:
For a long minute nothing seemed to happen. The rumbling behemoth that was Big Mac moaned and growled as his stomach rumbled like a distant rock-slide. And then, ever so slowly, but picking up speed little by little, Big macs stomach began to shrink.

“See? It's working,” Twilight smiled. However her glee was short-lived.

Big Mac groaned as he shuffled on the spot, his legs cramping terribly. He couldn't see what was happening but Twilight and Applejack could as his right leg began to shift, claws receded as toes plumped up. Soft pads grew under his appendage as it changed into a paw. The fur all along his leg also began to change color, turning golden with large irregular black spots appearing all along it up to his hip. His left leg meanwhile remained the same shape, but the fur was falling out to be replaced by the same colored red scales

“What in Tartarus!?” Applejack exclaimed in shock, “Twilight what did you do to my brother!?”

“I... I don't know,” Twilight stammered, “This shouldn't be happening...”

Big mac shifted in place his backside briefly visible as Twilight saw his tail pushing out, growing long and ropy with a tuft of tan-ish fur sprouting from the end. The changes progressed up his back which seemed to be elongating a bit as his middle shrank a bit with the mass being used to fuel the growth. A pair of wings sprouted from behind his shoulders. The left one a dark blue like Luna's Night Guards and the right green, insect-like, and full of holes. A changelings wing.

Twilight I'm telling you to stop this!” Applejack was almost hysterical, “You have to have some spell that can do it.”

“Applejack I've never seen anything like this,” Twilight countered, barely able to take her eyes off the towering, near one hundred foot tall figure of Big Mac.

His arms stiffened as they changed next. The right one shifted colors to white with stripes, that might have been a zebras, only the stripes were red instead of black. The left meanwhile darkened almost completely to black but still had a faint red shine if the light his the fur just right and the hand shifted to that of a panther.

“Well well isn't this quite the sight.”

Both girls turned as Big Mac's head bean to rise, neck elongating in jerking spurts, to see the figure of Discord dangling off a cotton candy cloud.

“Discord!” Applejack snarled, “This is your doing isn't it? Change my brother back now!”

“Oh really Applejack,” Discord yawned, “Surely even you know what they say about assuming, don't you?”

“Well if this isn't because of you then what the heck is going on!” Twilight replied, glancing back at Big Mac as a pair of horns sprouted from his forehead.

The left one pointed back in a strange faintly corkscrew shape while the right curved gracefully back in one long curl with ribs on the outer edge. Twilight, well read as she was, recognized them as Addax and Ibex horns respectively.

“Well that will take some explanation,” Discord mused, here, let me give us a few moments.”

The mismatched being snapped his fingers and the world seemed to shift into a state of gray, colors were muted and there was no sound. Even Big Mac seemed motionless at present.

“Now then,” Discord snapped his fingers and a pair of chairs and a chalkboard appeared, “Sit down both of you and I'll try to explain this as simply as I can.”

Applejack grumbled a bit but Twilight actually looked eager as she took a seat. Discord paced back and forth a couple times as he tried to find the right words to say.

“I doubt either of you knew this,” he stated finally, “But I am the last of my species. Yes, there are no other draconequuie in the universe.”

“You mean until now when you changed my brother,” Applejack snorted.

“Now Applejack what did I say about assuming?” Discord smiled, “I didn't do this. The universe did.”

“What?” Applejack retorted in disbelief, “You mean the wold just decided to turn my brother into a draconequus for no durn good reason?”

“I just told you the reason,” Discord smiled, “I'm the only one left.”

At Applejack's blank look Discord turned to Twilight, “Surely Celestia's faithful student here knows what happens when an equation is imbalanced right?”

“Well, in math any equation can't be solved unless both sides of an equals sign are balanced out.”

“Exactly,” Discord noted drawing on the chalkboard with his tail (in rainbow colored chalk interestingly enough), “You may scoff Applejack, but my kind plays a very important roll in the universe. We are the forces of change.”

Discord had drawn several stick-figure versions of himself on the board doing various things (all animated simply of course). Making flowers grow, digging a gorge, erupting a volcano.

“You think Celestia's perfect harmony is ideal, but if true order imposed itself on reality there would be no creativity, no change, no development. Without adversity nothing grows. Why would any of you have become friends if not for the incident with Nightmare Moon bringing you together?”

“So are you saying you caused that?” Applejack countered with a glare.

“Hardly,” Discord replied, “If you recall I was completely stoned at the time. And not the good kind of stoned either. My point is that a little chaos and unpredictability is a good thing. And until now I've been the only one in this whole universe really pushing it along. So now it seems the universe has begun to seek balance again and is helping to restore my species. Big mac just looks to be the first. More might come along. Though whether that's tomorrow or a thousand years from now I can't say.”

“So does that mean Big Mac has chaos powers too now?” Twilight asked looking a bit fearful.

Discord looked at the towering figure in consideration, “Unlikely. I wouldn't say no for certain. I was born in the very decline of my species, so I have the power to make lots of changes. The powers of total chaos you see. If my species is coming back Big Mac's powers might be more limited, able to only effect himself or a few close friends or maybe just food. I couldn't say. He certainly seems to have developed an affinity for food. And size. So it's possible his powers may revolve around that.”

“But there is a chance at least he might have your full chaos powers?” Twilight asked, torn between worried and interested.

“Possibly, but we'll see here in a minute, provided he's coherent yet. All the changes he's gone through have been a shock to his system. Hopefully he should snap out of it shortly.”

Discord snapped his fingers and once again the color returned to the world, just as Big Macs tusks gave a sudden surge and sprouted up from his lower lip to be level with the tip of his longer nose.

The changes were finished as Big mac now stood at a hundred and twenty feet tall, a bloated portly draconequus.
152221312.title: He becomes a draconequus!

152222.content:
Big Mac tasted little more than a bit too much parsley upon erasing the cobbler from existence in three big bites, its flavor disappearing just as quick as the satisfaction it brought him. He opened his mouth to bellow another command, Applejack's shoulders tensing up as she braced herself to hear that fateful word once again, but he only gave have of an 'm' when his stoic expression was rippled with surprise, a hand touching his stomach on instinct at a sudden warmth swelling up deep within.

In a matter of seconds, it seemed as though the cavernous emptiness that was gnawing inside of him had materialized into a massive thanksgiving feast that was still nice and warm, eyes rolling back into their sockets as his head sank back down into the fat of his own neck, a wobbly smile cracking his lips that was partly squished within his cheeks. Applejack watched his brother drift off into that bubbly state in a mix of doubt and amazement, astonished to see him actually stay there, seconds going by where he didn't scream his new favorite word at her, then let herself take what felt like the first deep breath she let had in almost an hour, if not a week. True, a part of her may have still been listening to Murphy's law, begging her not to fall into the tranquility of the scene, to take the chance and run before some corner of tartarus waiting beneath their house opened up and pulled them all under, but she only wanted to cherish the present for as long as she could. For now, as brief a moment it might be, her nightmare had come to an end.

Brief, sadly, was all it was meant to be.

The calm was rippled by a deep, bassy sound, one that she could only guess what its source was. Both of them looked to his enormous middle; it didn't quite sound like the traditional growl for when his overworked stomach was breaking down its endless fills, but a croak mixed between that of a frog's and the skin of a balloon being stretched. A squint of discomfort tightened along Big Mac's face, hand stroking against one of the rolls hanging at his middle's side. Applejack steeled herself, expecting just a little errant of gas, but then he bared his teeth as a groan of genuine pain scratched out from his throat, his hands clamping around the sides of his face.

"Big Mac? Big Mac, what's wrong?!" Applejack came to his side in worry, tenderly taking his arm, but she snapped back in fear when he thrust it back down on his knee, hand knotted into a fist, but the action alone wasn't what startled her. He uncurled his fingers, revealing to her that the tips were stretching out into stiff, claw-like points, and the fur on his arm was rapidly shedding off his arm like red snow, peeling away from a metallic layer of scales covering his skin. Her jaw hanging loose enough for her teeth to start going dry, Applejack glanced up at Big Mac's head, the fur shaving itself away from his face and neck as well, but his mouth and muzzle were stretching in unison to form a more pointed snout, his gritted teeth sharpening out into clean points. A pair of black horns sprouted out through his mane from the top of his head that pointed backwards, a pair of webbed fins unfurling from along the edges of his jawline.

His hooves split apart into reptilian talons that dug into the wooden floor, giving him all the grip he needed to straighten out and haul his indomitable size up. To add injury to even more injury, Big Mac was getting even bigger, his bones stretching to gradually add an extra few feet to his height. He shivered slightly, feeling a tear rip along the crotch of his overalls that let him feel his stomach's underside as it spread along more of the floor, amassing into even more of a gigantic, scaly ball, a wide strip of black armor running up along its surface from his tail to his very chin. A shredding noise tore all around his body as the muscles and lardy tissue in his arms and thighs became to massive for his clothes to conceal, leaving him almost totally naked, save for what would've been a comically large set of apple-decorated boxer shorts that stretched around his mammoth legs almost magically, one of the many foresights courtesy of Rarity in all her cooperation to keep Big Mac clothed.

He hunched forward, having to fight against the size of his middle as the pain tingled along two points on his back. Having backed up against the wall quite some time into his tranformation, Applejack could feel her breakfast try and fight its way back up from her stomach as two bony appendages rose from his shoulders blades in the form of hand-like digits. There didn't stay skinny for long, quick to leech off their mountainous owner's adipose and swaddle themselves in thick paddings of blubber, but the fingers stretched thinner and thinner, a thin webbing of black membrane fusing them together in a draconic set of wings. A wooden crash came from behind him as a wooden chair was crushed beneath a fatty tail springing out from over the crack of his colossal, its spine decorated by a black fin running all the way down his back.

Big Mac barely registered his head bumping against the ceiling and setting cracks in the plaster, nor the front of his stomach impaling the wall with the dining table as it kept on growing outward, but as his rebirth eased towards its end, he could feel the painful shifting and stretching of his skeleton begin to subside, yet still felt a burning heat growing in what was once the demanding void that his belly once housed. When the folds and tips of his wings were both able to touch the floor and ceiling when relaxed, he could feel the last of his bones snap into their new homes inside of him, mind now only focus on a large flame fighting to force its way up is throat. He opened his jaws wide, the orange-maned dragon looking prepared to give his first roar of power to the world... only to belch up a large cloud of red flame, its hue so bright that it resembled energized neon.

His eyelid shot open, pupils shrunken into slits that could pick up the tiniest of movements happening in the room. One in particular was a twitch of an eye nearby, and Big Mac craned his head to the side to see her sister gripping the wall with the backs of her arms and legs, shivering in fear.

Big Mac...

The twenty foot tall beast that had been a pony mere minutes before looked down at Applejack and seemed about to speak when his massive boulder sized belly gave a roar that sounded more like a wild animal than anything an internal organ could create.

Applejack was trembling as she looked at her brothers gleaming eyes. Terrible as it was she was certain he might just devour her then and there with no regard for who she was. Some part of her insisted she run or try to fight back when he came after her, crazy as that sounded in her own head, but her limbs simply refused to move as she stared at the mass that had been her brother.

Fortunately, whatever mind was in that newly reshaped skull of Big Mac's, either resisted the idea of an easy pony sized snack or recognized her enough to not try anything.

...That however did not apply to the rest of the kitchen.

Impossible as it seemed Big Mac grabbed a whole cabinet off the wall and began shoving it, contents and all, into his mouth. The wood splintered, the dishes inside crunched and smashed, but the massive creature hardly seemed to care as bite after bite was forced down his bulging throat. More of the kitchen soon followed, the refrigerator was emptied first then devoured whole, the stove bent like taffy under the dragons powerful jaws. And all of it piled into his gut swelling it larger and larger from the sheer mass it contained.

Eventually Big mac cleared enough room to turn himself over and then tor through the doorway, ripping a gaping hole in the wall as the massive dragon rolled out onto the back lawn. He paused only to get to his clawed feet and then stomped towards the nearest apple tree, uprooted it, and munched it down from the tips of the branches to the root-ball underneath.

Perhaps it was seeing one of her apple trees destroyed that finally galvanized Applejack enough to move. Though all she could do was shakily wobble to the hole in the wall and watch as the behemoth that was her brother waddle to the next tree and the next. And the next...

"Just what the Hay was in that stuff Twilight?"

15311.content:
There was no mistaking it. Adjusting to the new facilities was difficult. Dealing with her class size quickly quadrupling over the course of a year was difficult. Dealing with the new students from exotic lands, who had none of the respect for her that she’s spent so long fostering in the Ponyville community, was difficult. But in the end, if she was able to brighten and enlighten her student’s lives, she was happy. And besides, she had her ways of ‘coping’ with difficult times.

Cheerilee just couldn’t help but stuff her face, even when she was at the head of her class. Whenever some disrespectful colt started talking back to her, she busted out a chocolate bar and starting chewing. Whenever parents rush in loudly blaming her because their foal isn’t trying at all and thus is getting bad grades, she goes and binges on ice cream. She figures it’s not that unhealthy of a response, when you really think about. Some people get depressed. Some people get angry. Cheerilee… just eats. Surely, that’s not so bad, right?

Well… to be honest, she has been putting on a worrying amount of weight over the last year. Nothing that bad, honest! It’s just… her cheeks have been getting a little rounder, her legs a little thicker, her tummy a little squishier, her flanks a little jigglier. She’s gone from being a sprightly young mare to having more of a… ‘doughy’ look. It certainly didn’t earn her any extra favor with her new students. Many of them cracked jokes about her behind her back, especially saying that her flank won’t be able to fit through doorways soon. At this rate, they may be right...

She had to admit, she had a bit of a potbelly going on. When she walked, it swung back and forth beneath her slightly, and her rump jiggled just the slightest bit. Still, she keeps telling herself she’s not fat, only plump! And while that may be true, she knows that this is but a taste of what’s to come. If her job keeps stressing her out this much, there was no way she was going to lose all this weight any time soon, or even stop gaining. She shudders to imagine just how fat she might get if something doesn’t give soon!

Today, her class is unruly. Yeah, what else is new? All these new students seemed to have no respect for her, and the problem only worsened as she gained weight. Worse still, she can’t really punish any of them or their parents will come running, and their parents are almost more rude than their foals. Every time one of her students blows her off and disrespects her, it hurts. Every time one of her students makes fun of her behind her back, it hurts. But instead of getting upset, she reminds herself to take a snack from her desk drawer and try to calm herself down.

They were just foals, after all. They might not respect her now, but eventually, with hard work and dedication, she’ll get through to them, and show them that learning can be fun and fulfilling. Enlightening her student’s lives was her talent, after all. Her days weren’t all bad; watching her brighter students make progress and excitedly learn new things was always heartwarming and exciting for her. Still, over the course of an average day’s work, she probably packs away about 2,500 calories.

After an eight hour day, she still lingers around the school for about three hours or so to grade papers, counsel students, meet with parents and all that. That builds up her appetite for after hours, when she really lets loose. She likes to stop by sugar cube corner on her way home for a big, delicious pastry feast just to unwind after work. At home, she tends to binge on ice cream, chocolate, and other snacks just to keep her mind off her anxiety. At this point, she was probably eating over 5,000 calories a day.

She’s completely given up on keeping track of her weight. Just stepping on a scale fills her with anxiety. What’s she supposed to do? Exercise? She worked over twelve hours a day! Where would she find the time for proper exercise? Portion control? She just didn’t know of any other ways to cope with the stress. Eating made her feel better, and not eating made her feel worse, ergo, through sheer Pavlovian condition, she just can’t help but eat.

The main problem; the incredible amounts of snacks she burns through every day is killer on her budget. She’s already being paid a pitiful amount, and worried percentage of that is going to food. If she wants to maintain her appetite, she’ll have to find a way to avoid breaking her budget...
15311.title: Stress Eating Cheerilee

153113.content:
You remember all those snacks Cheerilee’s been munching on over the day, right? Were you wondering how she got her hooves on all those? Well, believe it or not, they mostly seemed to come from her students! Back in the days, it was customary for some of them to leave an apple on her desk… but when she started gaining weight, they started leaving candy on her desk instead. Now, every student seems to bring some kind of treat or another, and Cheerilee has no idea where they’re getting it all!

Whenever she asked, they always came up with a new excuse, but at this point, Cheerilee was certain they were getting them from the same place. It was like her students had a vested interest in making sure she gains weight. Not that she didn’t appreciate the extra treats, but she would like to know where they’re getting all these snacks, and what exactly their motives are for feeding her. Perhaps it wouldn’t be a good idea to stare a gift horse in the mouth…

Her expression brightened when she walked into the Sugarcube Corner that afternoon, however, and noticed Rarity sitting at one of the booths! That fashionista was the caretaker of one of Cheerilee’s original students, but nowadays she seemed to be travelling all across Equestria most of the town, dealing with her boutiques. It was a surprise to see her at the bakery. “Oh! Miss Rarity! Why, it’s nice to see you around Ponyville…” Cheerilee greeted as she took a seat on the stool next to Rarity’s, her big rump squishing against her seat as the stool creaks beneath her weight.

Rarity looks up at her, a little confused for a moment. Cheerilee realizes that the mare’s having trouble recognizing her! Has she really put on THAT much weight! Eventually, Rarity has a flash of cognisance in her eyes. “Ah! Cheerilee! Why, you’re looking marvelous this afternoon!” Rarity complimented her, trying not to make the mare feel insecure about her weight. Cheerilee just felt patronized. “I’ve seen the new schoolhouse they’ve built! Ponyville’s really making leaps, I’d say. It’s wonderful that our foals get access to such fine facilities.”

Cheerilee nodded. “Of course! The deserve the very best,” she said, though there was something else one on her mind. Rarity went back to reading her newspaper, and Cheerilee wondered if it was really wise to bother her with this, but this question would probably drive her crazy otherwise. “I just… had a question I’ve been wondering regarding Sweetie Belle.”

Rarity looks up. “Did she do something wrong?”

“Oh, no, no! Not at all! Quite the opposite, actually. At least, I think,” Cheerilee explained sheepishly. “This may sound a little silly, but... her and the other students have been bringing me snacks everyday. As in, a ton of snacks. And I was just wondering if you had any idea where they might be getting it all from...”

Rarity places a hoof on her chin, considering it. “Why, that is strange! I haven’t the foggiest! Sweetie Belle doesn’t even eat snacks, so she definitely hasn’t been asking me for any...” They probably plopped about 20 bits worth of candy on her desk every single morning… which may not sound like a lot, but these foals don’t have any income! They must be getting them from somewhere. “Would you like me to ask her about it?”

Cheerilee wasn’t about to waste anypony else’s time with this silly business. “Oh, no! Don’t worry about it. It’s not really important. I’m just curious,” she says. She resolves to get to the bottom of this on her own time. She didn’t really know why she was so curious. Of course, the worst case scenario is that they’re stealing all the candy… but she doubted her students would do something like this. There must be a more reasonable explanation…

Soon, Mrs. Cake emerges from the back room balancing some exotic looking ice cream on her back. She places it gently in front of Rarity, who coos in excitement as she starts chowing down. Her table manners are much more refined than Cheerilee’s, she notices. She has to work on that. Once that was settled, Mrs. Cake turns to Cheerilee. “Ah, Mrs. Cheerilee! Good afternoon! Will you be having the usual?” She smiled. They’d been through this countless times before.

Cheerilee nodded, simply. “Yes, please. Thank you,” she said. She couldn’t help but watch Mrs. Cake’s rump jiggle slightly as the older mare walked back into the kitchen. Mrs. Cake seemed to be the only other pony in Ponyville that was as ‘big’ as Cheerilee… and at this rate, it seems Cheerilee will soon surpass her. The fattest pony in all of Ponyville! That would be an embarrassing title…

Not embarrassing enough to stop her from eating though. She licked her lips, practically drooling at the mouth when Mrs. Cake eventually wheeled out a big cart stuffed with a spread of different, delicious pastries. The smell evoked a powerful sense of gluttony within Cheerilee, and the mare’s big tummy growled loudly. Rarity, who was a much lighter eater, couldn’t help but stare in awe for a moment at the size of Cheerilee’s meal as it was plopped down in front of her. Cheerilee thanked Mrs. Cake, before eagerly digging in, stuffing her face full with seemingly ravenous efficiency.

Rarity’s stunned. Within a couple of minutes, the scrumptious pastries on Cheerilee’s plate are reduced to nothing but crumbs! She knows its rude to stare, but she can’t help but glance at how the teacher’s belly seemed slightly bigger and rounder after her meal. The once demure teacher leaned back with a satisfied sigh, patting and rubbing her full tummy with her hooves. Every single day, Cheerilee tells herself that this is the last day she’s going to binge like this. Every single day, she just keeps coming back! How is she supposed to resist, though, when the bakery’s pastries are so delicious?

Tasty snacks were like antidepressants for Cheerilee! … sad as that was. Still, as she paid for her meal, she’s grimly reminded of just how much her appetite was breaking the bank. It was actually quite fortunate that her students seemed to want to chip in, or she’d probably go broke trying to buy all the snacks she eats every day. Her full tummy swayed to and fro beneath her as she walked home, a little smile constantly on her face, the sensation of being full brightening her spirits as they always do. Once she makes it home, she spends the rest of the night grading papers, eating ice cream, and cleaning up around the house…

Early the next morning, Cheerilee shows up over an hour before class starts as always, busily working around the classroom to get things set up. She was definitely not a morning person, so she needed this extra hour to really wake up and prepare for another exhausting day. Eventually, she heard little hoofsteps coming from down the hall, indicating that one of her students was walking in early! Indeed, Cheerilee turned to see Sweetie Belle’s smiling face as she stepped inside! “Good morning, miss Cheerilee!” Sweetie Belle smiled, placing a chocolate bar on her teacher’s desk as she walked by.

“Good morning, Sweetie Belle,” Cheerilee smiled. She’s worked with the filly for years, and Sweetie’s always been a model student. All A’s, very polite and respectful, the likes. Definitely lives up to her older sister’s pedigree. The way she set that candy bar down on her desk, though, reminded Cheerilee of the concerns she was having yesterday. Just as Sweetie Belle was about to walk over to her seat, Cheerilee lifted a hoof. “Uh, Sweetie Belle! There’s something I’ve been wondering.”

The filly turns. “Yes, miss Cheerilee?”

Cheerilee holds up the chocolate bar. “Where, exactly, did you get this?”

Cheerilee knew how to read foal’s expressions, and judging from Sweetie Belle’s expression, she was trying to come up with a lie - fast. “Oh, I just had a ton of candy last night, and I couldn’t eat it all! So I figured, hey, why not give the leftovers to my beloved teacher?” She said with a nervous smile.

Cheerilee raised a brow, incredulously. “Is that so? Your sister, Rarity, told me you don’t eat candy…”

Sweetie Belle’s ears lowered, and a distressed look dawned on her face. She looked guiltily at the floor, realizing she’d been caught in a lie. “Okay. I’m sorry. That wasn’t very honest,” Sweetie Belle sighed. “The truth is, we get the candy from…”

An interactive featuring characters from the show My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic. Thems will focuss on weight gain, inflation expansions of all kind and more.

As always i have a number of rules here. Quick copy, paste, and edit from my other stories.

RULES:
#1 - No gore or death. Characters should not be killed if at all possible. If, for example, you plan on having a plot revolving around mafia-esq characters who might be assumed to be killing others, keep such events off screen and not described in more detail than necessary. So short of adding drama to the plot, death should not factor in for the main character if at all possible.

#2 - Keep vore to a minimum. The reason being because there are interesting ways of voring individuals that could be used to make a individual 'bigger'. Non-fatal ways. Either way, for whatever reason, voring does not kill characters here.

#3 - No short posts. Any post added must be a minimum of one to three paragraphs or approximately two hundred and fifty words. Which is not as hard as some might think. Longer posts will be greatly appreciated though. Small posts should ONLY be reserved for adding more chapter options, and even then, try to be creative with more elaboration before adding other choices.

#4 – Give everyone an out. All chapters should have two options at the very least. Give everyone a chance to follow the story you want to see and a way to escape that path if they want.

#5 – Keep the flow. Everyone is entitled to interject their own ideas, however do not suddenly stop a story line for no reason to start a new one. So if there's a character given super powers, don't just suddenly strip them from the individual for some arbitrary reason and dump him somewhere to start your story. See point 4. If everyone is given an 'out' then everyone will get the chance for the story they want.

#6 – Keep the focus towards Weight Gain and Inflation of various kinds. Transformation can play a part too, as well as other changes, but WG and Inflation should be the main subjects of interest of the city for the most part.

#8 – Oviposition or egg-laying. Some writers like like the idea of a character being expanded with hundreds of eggs, and I will allow this. However! All eggs laid must be infertile and not be destined to hatch into hundreds of babies. If having children is to be part of the story keep the number to a minimal amount no matter how many eggs are involved. OR hundreds of thousands of eggs/births have to have the beings born be able to take care of themselves.

#9 – Lastly, have fun with this. Get creative. The rules above are guidelines rather than strict 'do not cross' guardrails for the most part. However, take note of each since anything falling into such 'unpleasent' categories may be removed if it is deemed inappropriate in one form or another. Such actions will not happen without the author being told though and giving them a chance to correct their chapter. Any abuse or rude behavior, including mean spirited posting, will be removed without such notification though, so 'play nice'.
